017package org.microbean.loader.spi;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
020import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
021import java.lang.reflect.Type;
022
023import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
024
025import org.microbean.path.Path;
026
027/**
028 * A service provider of {@link Value}s that might be suitable for a
029 * {@link Loader} implementation to return.
030 *
031 * <p>{@link Provider} instances are subordinate to {@link
032 * org.microbean.loader.DefaultLoader}.</p>
033 *
034 * <p>Any {@link Provider} implementation must have a {@code public}
035 * constructor that has no arguments.</p>
036 *
037 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
038 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
039 *
040 * @see #get(Loader, Path)
041 *
042 * @see AbstractProvider
043 *
044 * @see org.microbean.loader.DefaultLoader
045 */
046@FunctionalInterface
047public interface Provider {
048
049
050  /*
051   * Instance methods.
052   */
053
054
055  /**
056   * Returns a {@link Type} representing the <em>lower type bound</em>
057   * of all possible {@linkplain Value values} {@linkplain
058   * #get(Loader, Path) supplied} by this {@link Provider}.
059   *
060   * <p>Often the value returned by implementations of this method is
061   * no more specific than the lowest possible type, which is {@code
062   * null}, meaning that the {@link Provider} has at least a chance of
063   * {@linkplain #get(Loader, Path) producing} a {@link Value} for any
064   * requested type.</p>
065   *
066   * <p>A return value of, for example, {@link String String.class}
067   * indicates that the {@link Provider} may satisfy requests for
068   * {@link String String.class}, or any of its supertypes (such as
069   * {@link CharSequence}), but cannot satisfy requests for {@link
070   * Integer Integer.class}, for example.</p>
071   *
072   * <p>A return value of {@link Object Object.class} indicates a
073   * maximally opaque type, i.e. only requests for {@link Object
074   * Object.class} have the possibility of being satisfied by this
075   * {@link Provider}.  Such a return value is possible, but rarely
076   * used, and {@link Provider} implementations are urged to consider
077   * a different {@link Type}.</p>
078   *
079   * <p>Note that this method is used solely to help eliminate types,
080   * not permit them.  That is, although {@link Provider} may indicate
081   * via an implementation of this method that a given {@link Type} is
082   * suitable, it is not thereby obliged to return a {@link Value}
083   * corresponding to it from its {@link #get(Loader, Path)
084   * get(Loader, Path)} method implementation.</p>
085   *
086   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@code
087   * null}.</p>
088   *
089   * @return a {@link Type} representing the lower type bound of all
090   * possible {@linkplain Value values} {@linkplain #get(Loader, Path)
091   * supplied} by this {@link Provider}, or {@code null} to indicate
092   * the lowest possible type bound
093   *
094   * @nullability This method does, and overrides may, return {@code
095   * null}.
096   *
097   * @idempotency This method is, and overrides of this method must
098   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
099   *
100   * @threadsafety This method is, and overrides of this method must
101   * be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
102   */
103  public default Type lowerBound() {
104    return null; // the lowest possible type, assignable to all others
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Returns a {@link Value} suitable for the supplied {@link
109   * Loader} and {@link Path}, or {@code null} if there is no such
110   * {@link Value} now <strong>and if there never will be such a
111   * {@link Value}</strong> for the supplied arguments.
112   *
113   * <p>In addition to the other requirements described here, the
114   * following assertions will be (and must be) true when this method
115   * is called in the normal course of events:</p>
116   *
117   * <ul>
118   *
119   * <li>{@code assert absolutePath.isAbsolute();}</li>
120   *
121   * <li>{@code assert
122   * absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.absolutePath());}</li>
123   *
124   * <li>{@code assert
125   * !absolutePath.equals(requestor.absolutePath());}</li>
126   *
127   * </ul>
128   *
129   * <p>If any caller does not honor these requirements, undefined
130   * behavior may result.</p>
131   *
132   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} seeking a {@link Value};
133   * must not be {@code null}
134   *
135   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
136   * <code>Path</code>} for which the supplied {@link Loader} is
137   * seeking a value; must not be {@code null}
138   *
139   * @return a {@link Value} more or less suitable for the combination
140   * of the supplied {@link Loader} and {@link Path}, or {@code
141   * null} if there is no such {@link Value} now <strong>and if there
142   * never will be such a {@link Value}</strong> for the supplied
143   * arguments
144   *
145   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code requestor} or
146   * {@code absolutePath} is {@code null}
147   *
148   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code absolutePath}
149   * {@linkplain Path#absolute() is not absolute}, or if {@link
150   * Path#startsWith(Path)
151   * !absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.absolutePath())}, or if {@link
152   * Path#equals(Object)
153   * absolutePath.equals(requestor.absolutePath())}
154   *
155   * @nullability Implementations of this method may return {@code
156   * null}.
157   *
158   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
159   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
160   *
161   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
162   * but are not assumed to be deterministic.
163   */
164  public Value<?> get(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath);
165
166}
